definition: old illness recurs (idiom); a relapse/fig. to repeat an old error/the same old problem
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: John Terry has not had a relapse.
Take this medicine regularly; it will guard you against a return of the illness.
sentences.chinese: 你要按時服這種藥，它會保證你免於舊病復發。

sentences.english: But, I would get a little crazy because I was so afraid my leukemia had returned.
sentences.chinese: 我變得有點瘋狂，因爲太害怕自己舊病復發。

sentences.english: He was born silly and had a relapse.
sentences.chinese: 他生來就笨，而且還會舊病復發。

sentences.english: Take this medicine regularly, it will safeguard you against a return of the disease.
sentences.chinese: 定期服用這種藥，它能防止你舊病復發。

sentences.english: If the psychological factors are not corrected, the dog will usually relapse after the drugs are discontinued.
sentences.chinese: 如果精神因素沒有被糾正，犬隻在停藥後會舊病復發。

sentences.english: He can't return to work because he's had a relapse.
sentences.chinese: 他不能回去工作，因爲舊病復發了。
